title.narrative: Liberia: Targeted country assistance
Libéria (le): Aide ciblée aux pays

description.narrative:
L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

Cette activité détaille notre travail sur le Aide ciblée aux pays en Libéria (le), grâce à la mise à disposition des données budgétaires et des transactions. Nous fournissons également les documents pertinents qui guident ces activités que sont les formulaires de demande de soutien fournis par le gouvernement de Libéria (le) ainsi que les lettres de décisions émises par Gavi, pour progresser. Ces documents décrivent les activités, les objectifs ainsi que les bénéficiaires.

This activity details our work on Targeted country assistance in Liberia through the provision of budget and transaction data. We also provide the relevant documents that guide these activities, which are the support request proposal(s) provided by the Government of Liberia, as well as the decision letter(s) issued by Gavi, for progress. These documents describe the activities, the objectives as well as the beneficiaries.

title.narrative: WHO
Guidelines, SOPs and training materials available. TCV introduced and available in all counties

target.value: 5. TCV Introduction a. Provide techncial support for development of guidelines, SOPs and training materials for TCV introduction b. Monitor the introduction of TCV in the field and used lesson learnt for future introduction and planning

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply chain
Timely clearance of vaccines and related supplies

target.value: Clearance of vaccines and related supplies by third party service provider
Clearance of vaccines and related supplies by third party service provider

title.narrative: 1. All Vaccines and Cold Chain Equipment are cleared in a timely manner from the port of entry. 2.100% of accuracy and timeliness of VARS completed and shared with UNICEF Supply Division.

target.value: Provide technical support for the custom clearance of vaccines and cold chain equipment including their distribution, installation and capacity building of at least 3 National EPI Logistic Officers on custom clearance procedures through the recruitment of 1 National TA with UNICEF. The TA consultant will spend 60% of his/her with EPI and 40% with UNICEF. 1. Review the pre-alert document for completeness 2. Timely report the status of the shipment and quality of the vaccines using vaccine arrival report (VAR form)

title.narrative: Three National EPI Logistic Officers have the capacity to coordinate and supervise the custom clearance of vaccines and EPI Related Supplies.

target.value: Provide technical support for the custom clearance of vaccines and cold chain equipment including their distribution, installation and capacity building of at least 3 National EPI Logistic Officers on custom clearance procedures through the recruitment of 1 National TA with UNICEF. The TA consultant will spend 60% of his/her with EPI and 40% with UNICEF. 1. Review the pre-alert document for completeness 2. Timely report the status of the shipment and quality of the vaccines using vaccine arrival report (VAR form)

title.narrative: 1. Temperature re-mapping exercise completed at all cold rooms (central and regional) and reports available. 2. Remedial action taken based on the finding of the mapping 3. Implement the preventative and corrective maintainance plans 4. Supportive supervision to selected counties/facilities completed and joint action plan developed for cold chain logisitcs and vaccine management improvement 5. Job aids printed and distributed to health facilites for use

target.value:
"Support and coordinate the temperature re-mapping of freezer room at central cold store and also cold rooms at regional stores: Key activities a. Update a temperature mapping protocol. b. Carry out the temperature mapping exercise. c. Prepare a temperature mapping report. d. Implement the recommendations by carrying out remedial actions e. Install Beyond Wireless system at Grand Gedeh Regional Store
Strengthen Cold Chain Logisitcs and Vaccine Management Practices: a. Develop a system for equipment maintenance and build the capacity of county teams to develop preventive maintenance plans that will be regularly updated to reflect history of servicing and planned service dates. b. Conduct robust immunization supply chain supportive supervision to improve vaccines management, accountability, archiving best practices among others. c. Support the implementation of the EVM improvement plans (based on finding of self assessment) d. Print additional Job aids and ensure that they are posted and used in every health facility"

title.narrative: 1. Preparation for direct distribution of vaccine and other supplies to faciliteis under the catchment of Montserrdo county is completed 2. Implement direct distribution at Montserrado county 3. LTWG re-vitilized with revised TOR, annual plan and regular meetings

target.value: Provide technical support for systems design with a focus on direct distribution of bundled vaccines in Montserrado County Strengthen the National Logistics Working Group (NLWG): a. Regularize NLWG meetings b. Organize bi-annual review meetings of the NLWG (Logistics only review meeting) c. Roll-out the use of SMT at Lower Distribution levels d. Conduct capacity gap assessment of all County Cold chain officers

title.narrative: 1. Report of Direct Distribution including results and lessons learnt available. 2. LTWG conducts review meeting and evaluated performance

target.value: Provide technical support for systems design with a focus on direct distribution of bundled vaccines in Montserrado County Strengthen the National Logistics Working Group (NLWG): a. target.value:
"Support and coordinate the temperature re-mapping of freezer room at central cold store and also cold rooms at regional stores: Key activities a. Update a temperature mapping protocol. b. title.narrative: WHO : Vaccine-Specific Support
Support provided to sustain the institutionalization of Adverse events following immunization AEFI / AESI surveillance to enhance surveillance activities at all level and AEFI cases were reported

target.value: Support the institutionalization of Adverse events following immunization AEFI / AESI to enhance reporting AEFI / AESI to allow early detection of vaccine safety issues particularly with many new vaccines being introduced within a very short period of time. AEFI surveillance and response: a. Provide technical and logistic support for establishment, implementation and monitoring/evaluation of AEFI surveillance b. Facilitate electronic platform for AEFI surveillance reporting and feedback in Liberia c. Support the national AEFI causality assessment team to classify cases including field visits to verify reported cases d. Support AEFI technical committee Quartely review meetings

title.narrative: CDC Foundation : Health Information Systems (Data)

target.value: Provide technical assistance to conduct an evaluation of the existing typhoid surveillance and provide recommendations for strengthening surveillance in preparation for TCV introduction and vaccine impact assessment. Work in collaboration with partners to provide technical support for a potential Gavi application for TCV and pilot/use a rapid assessment tool to collate disease burden data.
